---------- Random Pop-Ups Start Here ------------
"But our journey isn't yet done. Are you sure?"
"Thank you, <FirstName>. May Tyr guide our steps into the future, then."
"Here? Very well, but hurry back as soon as you are able, as I will miss your warmth and company."
"I... I'm sorry, <FirstName>, it was not my intention to offend... I suppose I will return to the Gatehouse and pray for your quick and safe return."
"Yes, what do you feel would be more suitable?"
"Very well. I will try to take the changes we have made to heart."
"Very well. I will refrain from my castings and trust to my blade instead."
"Thank you. I will cast as I see fit, then."
"I will refrain where I can, though I admit it goes against my calling as a paladin."
"Of course. It is my duty as a paladin to keep us all in good health."
"That is for the best. I know little of them."
"I will do what I can, though the infernal things are often beyond my ken."
"Good. I'm afraid this armor doesn't leave me soft of foot."
"I will attack from the shadows when I can, though I must admit I prefer to keep my battles more straightforward."
"I will do what I can to remain quiet and out of sight."
"I will leave you to it, then, and not interfere."
"I will do what I am able should a lock be encountered."
"Of course. How far do you feel is suitable?"
"I shall attempt to follow you at that distance, then."
"With Tyr's might, I shall drive back our enemies!"
"By Tyr's might, I will shield you as long as I am able."
"Have you any other tactical issues you wish to discuss?"
"Very well but I'll not let you have my armor."
"I can try. Let me sort through your pack and see what you have."
"Let's see what I can do..."
"As you wish."
"As you wish."
"Of course. Would you prefer benefits that last over the longer term or only for the immediate future?"
"Of course. What spell should I cast for you?"
"Are you certain that is the spell you want?"
"As you wish. Who would you like me to cast it on?"
"Is there anything else I can do to help?"
"At once."
"Yes, I could use a break. It's always pleasant to sit and chat awhile."
"Is there anything more I can do for you?"
"I've been wondering why I don't try to run away from myself when I attempt to turn undead..."
"Is there anything more you'd like to chat about?"
"A little cold but I've been colder, haven't I..."
"I'm doing fine. Let's keep moving."
"My complexion's a little pale, don't you think?"
"I'm doing all right. It's you I'm worried about."
"No storm can stir my inmost calm."
"Healthy and hale."
"Not bad for a paladin in the Nine Hells, wouldn't you agree?"
"I am well enough. And you?"
"Something blinds me. I can see nothing of this world or the next."
"I am not at my best but my form holds together well enough. I vote we continue on."
"Can you not see how much I fade? I have been worse but a chance to rest and restore my form would be appreciated."
"I have all but faded. If we do not rest soon, I may disappear altogether."
"There is a venom in me, a fearful poison."
"I feel ill, as if a sickness courses through my ghostly veins."

"I've put some thought into it, <FirstName>, and I still feel drawn to Neverwinter. There is a time when I would have sought to haunt the place but perhaps I can be its protector, its guide, somehow."
"Yes, the future will come in its own time. Dwelling on it now will only slow its coming."
"It has been on my mind for some time. I only hope my presence there can bring peace to my old home."

"<FirstName>? It is not for you to allow or disallow... If it is an end you do not want for me, then you should have left me in the ice and never urged me to take up the mantle of my fallen paladinhood."
"We are in search of the Reaper's True Name, are we not? Should we succeed, suddenly all things become possible..."

"It's my penance, I think. I must serve that which I betrayed in life. But it's more than that, too. I want to walk its streets once more in summer, to hear the singing in the temple... It would be a pleasant end for me."
"Why I can't say I know... Not so long ago, I didn't feel I had a future left to ponder. Let me think on it a while."
"Death does something to your thoughts. They become thick and woolen. Your memories cloud over for a while... Suddenly I had doubts and I no longer knew how I felt about my crimes..."

"I was scared of the Hells, <FirstName>. And when Mephistopheles came, he played my confusion like a toy... It wasn't until you came that I realized the Hells can pose no threat to that which is still good in me."
"Of course. What is it you wish to ask?"
"Not if we persevere, no. Our quest is righteous and the gods will see us through, I have no doubt."
"And I'm happy that you did. You've set me back upon the path of righteousness and I shall not forget it, you have my word."
"Nonsense. You saw my distress and came to my aid. Despite all your gruff demeanor, I can still see the goodness you keep buried deep. It's that goodness that helped me find my own again."

"I have heard that when warriors lose a limb in battle, sometimes they can still feel it. It is as if the limb exists but by virtue of their imagination alone. That is how it is but for all of me, every part..."
"The world seems dimmer through my eyes, the sounds less full, the tastes less rich. Everything is at it was in life, though I experience it as if through cotton batting..."
"Yes, there is only so much I can tell of this afterlife that will make sense to you."

"I had no idea what to expect, to be honest. I had studied the Nine Hells in my training but it is one thing to read of Cania's frozen wastes and quite another to find myself almost a part of them..."
"Horrible? I admit I lived a fervent life so perhaps I miss the vibrancy of life more than most. But the Hells, I'm sure, have greater horrors yet in store for me..."
"That it could be. If this is all the punishment the Hells have in store for me, I would be surprised. Though maybe you have already saved me from the worst of it, <FirstName>."
"I... This is so hard to talk about, <FirstName>... I betrayed the ones I loved, I failed them so utterly. I led an army of evil to the city's gates and marched them in to occupy and slaughter..."
"Yes, all this talk of Neverwinter drains me. I still find it hard to put to words."

"I died on Neverwinter soil. At least I have that much to console me... One kind thing to come of all the destruction that I wrought. When the end came, it was almost merciful, as much as a violent death can be."
"I guess Cania is where the gods put a soul like mine. Or maybe it was my soul that sought it out. In the end, the snow seems rather fitting, don't you think?"
"Yes, they did. I only wish they could have done it sooner before I'd damned myself so fully. To their credit, they took me by surprise. I had always thought I would outlive the war."
"Why indeed... I ask myself that a lot. I think, at the heart of it, I was convinced that I was right and all the world was wrong around me. Oh, they did some bad things, made some mistakes but..."

"If the citizens of Neverwinter could not be perfect, I considered their failings a hypocrisy. Sometimes failings are just that: failings, nothing more. I was so self-righteous, I couldn't see the difference."
"Pirates from Luskan, orc tribes, sellswords, ancient magical orders... I twisted them all around my finger and made them serve me. If only I could have done so for a more noble cause..."
"I received my powers from a crone named Morag, the last Empress of her ancient race... But in the end it was myself I served. It would be a lie to suggest otherwise."

"Oh I grew up there! I ran as a child through its streets, I knew every nook and cranny, every weakness, every strength... If only I could have been ignorant of it all. Ignorance is bliss, they say..."
"If I had been been born a simpleton, my betrayal would have meant nothing! I was too smart for my own good, <FirstName>... With an artist's eye, I knew to destroy something of great beauty..."
"I... I'm still trying to figure that out, <FirstName>. I don't think I'm ready to talk about it yet. Maybe we can talk about again sometime in the future..."
"Funny, I'd been thinking the same thing..."
"Has anyone ever told you how passive aggressive you are?"
"Here? Fine, but make it quick."
"Gladly! You can come crawling back to me at the Gatehouse when you run into trouble."
"Why? I have no need of change. You are the one making all the mistakes!"
"Good. At least there are some things you chose not to meddle with..."
"As you wish. My blade grows hungry for the blood of innocents."
"What now? Is dark magic back in vogue?"
"Yes, let them suffer..."
"Oh really... Maybe I will, maybe I won't..."
"Have it your way."
"Consider it done. Though if I choose to leave one for you, consider it a present."
"What a shame. I was just starting to enjoy myself."
"I will strike from the darkness."
"To the shadows it is."
"Very well, I'll leave you to it."
"Fine but I will be mocking you under my breath every time I do so."
"Oh, so that's how it is, is it?"
"Very well, I will try to keep to your foolish distance though I don't see how much it will truly help once the blood starts flowing."
"It would be my pleasure."
"Very well, we shall play it safe though he who risks nothing dies a fool."
"Have you other 'changes' you insist on making?"
"Fine, but the armor stays."
"It would be my pleasure..."
"Ha! For how long would you like my powers to last?"
"What is it now?"
"Are you sure? I would hate for there to be any... slip-ups..."
"Who will suffer?"
"What else would you have me do, then?"
"Consider it done."
"Of course..."
"Good, I was just starting to get bored with you."
"All the Hells for a basement, <FirstName>. Don't worry about me."
"Will there be anything else?"
"Curiosity killed the cat, <FirstName>. Don't push your luck."
"Just pondering the evil I could sow, that is all."
"I grow in power every day."
"I'll be fine."
"Like I could tear the head off a puppy, why?"
"Like I could haunt an entire continent. Let's keep moving."
"None of your business, <FirstName>. I have no need of your concern."
"Evil, <FirstName>. Decidedly evil."
"I am blinded. I cannot see a thing, be it in this world or the next!"
"I am not at the height of my powers but I am not far from them, either. I suggest we carry on."
"I am fading, <FirstName>. I can hold my form for some time yet but a chance to rest and restore my powers would be appreciated."
"I am fading very fast. I fear it will not be much longer before you cannot even see me at all."
"A poison courses through me."
"I feel sickly, as if some disease wastes away at me."
"I have decided that I am not yet done with Neverwinter. Don't you think the temple there could use a malevolent spirit? Or if holy ground proves troublesome, what of the castle there?"
"If it amuses you, though I must admit you are taking an uncanny interest in my affairs."
"It has been on my mind for some time. I dare say, it sounds like a Hell of a good time, wouldn't you agree...?"
"And I'll never ask permission... I am sorry, <FirstName>, but you have set me on a course and I will not be dissuaded. Neverwinter will fall and I will fashion my throne amidst its haunted ruins."
"We are in search of the Reaper's True Name, are we not? Should we succeed, suddenly all things become possible..."
"To disturb its graveyards, despoil its grounds, and drive its citizens before me like rats. When I am done, not a single living soul will dare call that city home!"
"I can't say I'm entirely sure yet. It seems not so long ago I had decided to surrender my ambitions altogether. But you're right, my malevolence is not yet spent."
"I will ponder your question for a while. Perhaps I will have a better answer for you later."
"Death does something to your thoughts. They become thick and woolen. Your memories cloud over for a while... Suddenly I had doubts, feelings of guilt over what I had done..."

"I was scared of the Hells, <FirstName>. I was raised by the church, remember? And Mephistopheles played my sorrows like a toy... It wasn't until you came that I realized that the Hells are not to be feared but embraced!"
"Of course. Mephistopheles is busy ravaging Toril and you feel like playing Twenty Questions... I don't have any problems with that if you don't."
"How very noble of you... I haven't decided if I'm grateful to you or not. Perhaps I'll kill you some day and paw through your entrails to help me arrive at a decision."
"How very funny. I don't recall thanking you. In fact, some day I may choose to kill you for it. But who's to say? You might make a fine minion..."
"You have unchained a great evil in me and what is more you never bound me to your cause. In time, you may come to regret that. Perhaps you already do... More's the pity."

"I have heard that when warriors lose a limb in battle, sometimes they can still feel it. It is as if the limb exists but by virtue of their imagination alone. That is how it is but for all of me, every part..."
"I am because I believe myself to be. Maybe all of this is but the dreaming of a fetid corpse. For all I know, <FirstName>, you are but a maggot gnawing at my eye."
"Feel the sudden need to change the subject, do you? That's a sign of weakness. Don't worry, I'll forgive it but I won't forget..."
"That would explain a lot, wouldn't it..."
"No, it's vile. There's a difference... Besides, I would think that you would take at least some responsibility for my words. You were, after all, the one to play the devil's advocate, as it were."
"It has its moments. You should try it sometime... Regardless, as far as maggots go, you're not half-bad. It certainly beats contemplating one's destiny alone."
"I brought it to its knees, <FirstName>! I cut a swath down the Sword Coast and led an army to its gates! I gave it a nightmare that it may wake from but it will never forget!"
"They say that curiosity killed the cat, <FirstName>. But go ahead. Proceed. Let's see how far you get before I grow weary of you..."
"I died on Neverwinter's frozen soil and cursed it with my blood. That was my victory, <FirstName>. Even they could not take that from me in the end."
"I guess Cania is where the gods put a soul like mine. Or maybe it was my soul that sought it out. In the end, the snow seems rather fitting, don't you think?"

"I may be dead but do I look defeated? Thanks to you, my vengeance has just begun... I broke their spirit. I held a mirror to their shame. I taught them how to loathe themselves and I am not done yet..."
"My Lord Nasher demanded justice so I delivered it to him in spades! I may not have loved Fenthick, the fool I was to marry, but nor did he deserve a callous execution!"
"He loved me and I saw no cause to disagree. He was a sheep among wolves and I took pity on him, nothing more."
"Long before humans ever set foot in the North, long before even the elves, it was the seat of a great empire. Time erased that empire but the one who ruled it lingered on."

"Her name was Morag and I could see no justice more appropriate than restoring Neverwinter to its rightful owner. The tribes, the pirate clans, the ancient orders, the sellswords, I led them all to war."
"And even then they groveled before me, bending and scraping, saying their foolish prayers. I was their paladin and they thought that would make me blind to their hypocrisy... Oh no, I saw it all..."

"The injustice of their law, the tyranny of their lord, the futility of their faith, the corruption of their guards. Everywhere I looked, there were lies. If ever there was a city that deserved its fate..."
"Ha! Don't be so presumptuous, <FirstName>... I hardly know you. I transformed, all right? I touched my destiny! It's a story you're not ready to hear... Come back when you've earned it."
"I teach, I instruct, I aid... but I do not lecture, <FirstName>, mark my words..."
"Perhaps it is different in some worlds than it is in ours but here, the Hells seem but another stop along the lengthy pilgrimage of the soul; a black bead along a string of pearls."

"Death is a beginning, not an end. Life is but a fraction of our existence, a simple tutorial preparing us for the many lives beyond. The Heavens and the Hells lie along a continuum but even they cannot encompass all that is."
"Whatever the Hells can throw my way, I deserve... But the burden has been light thus far. Almost too light. I can't help but think that something more dire yet awaits me."
"According to my temple training, the outer planes are divinely morphic: He who rules the plane can also shape it. All this ice and lava is here because Mephistopheles wants it here."
"I wonder what will happen now that he's gone..."
"Yes? We are still discussing the nature of the Hells, are we not?"

"It's precisely the arbitrary nature of the Hells that makes them so horrible, don't you see? If all this ice and lava had a logical reason for their existence, then they would lose their power over our minds."
"I'm not so sure. I think he's abandoned Cania. What worries me is that I suspect he hopes to make Toril his throne now."
"He doesn't need it anymore. He who rules the deepest Hell of Baator rules them all! Asmodeus rules the Ninth but our friend is hoping to make Toril the Tenth and thereby seize the prize."

"Yes, in Neverwinter, remember? One isn't just born a paladin. There is quite a lot of esoteric study involved. It just never occurred to me that I'd get this much first-hand experience with the Hells..."
"Yes, I toil over them within my heart, fashioning them into the shapes of countless sorrows..."

"That is why I dare not forget, <FirstName>. I was a fool there, too, and some of their folly lies on my shoulders. I must believe that folly can be forgiven for otherwise despair shall be the only destiny I ever know."
"I keep thinking of Lord Nasher as he stood before the mob to announce that both Fenthick and Desther were to die... I know now that it was fear I saw in him..."

"No, not happy ones at all... I keep thinking of Lord Nasher as he stood before the mob to announce that both Fenthick and Desther were to be put to death. I know now that it was fear I saw in him..."

"Don't you see? The mob in the streets, in their plague-struck squalor, held more power than a lord sitting in comfort on his throne! He ruled them but even so, he feared them. The plague was but a tool."

"All Desther wanted was an angry mob, a weakened lord, and a paladin to lose her faith. We all played into his hand and that was why he grinned even as we burned him at the stake. Evil is insidious..."
"Lord Nasher insisted that, as paladin of Tyr, I be the one to declare their guilt but I refused. He was old, still sick, and didn't want to face the crowds waiting outside the temple doors."
"But I made him do it and in that moment I could tell that I was on a darkening course. And when Fenthick fell and his neck snapped and his feet dangled... the darkness consumed me."

"Desther claimed to be a Tyrran priest come from afar to serve the church but instead he spread disease with every blessing. Fenthick refused to see it and how could I doubt the man I told myself I loved..."
"They were both weak men in their own way. I should have spoken up. There should have been something I could say... Instead I left them to Lord Nasher and the mob."
--------- Random Conversations begin here ----------

"Power is a siren's song, <FirstName>, and responsibility a leaden weight. I pray I do not see you topple by it... Every True Name you learn is someone's fate within your hands. Be careful what you seek."

"Power is a siren's song, <FirstName>. When faced with the option, how do you know you will not pick another? ...Every True Name you learn is someone's fate within your hands. Be careful what you seek."
"Power is a siren's song, <FirstName>. It corrupts good and evil in equal measure. Every True Name you learn is someone's fate within your hands... Just be careful of what you seek."
"No. Power is a siren's song, <FirstName>. Once she's freed, you may not hear my warning. Listen to me now... Every True Name you learn is someone's fate within your hands. Be careful what you seek."
"That may be so but it does not dissuade me from fearing the contrary. But I have said my piece. Go free the poor woman and do what you will do."

"Yes, a little. I would be a fool to surrender my destiny so lightly... But it is for the sake of all the others that I warn you. Please, <FirstName>, heed my words and do not damn yourself in your pursuit of power."
"Thank you. You know I would not caution you lightly."
"It's in the Neverwinter Wood, northeast of the city. Fenthick first kissed me there and we carved our initials in the tree... I was so foolish, then. Innocent, I guess..."

"Then, yes, there was a time... But after they hung him, I fled to that tree and cried like all my future was torn to shreds. I just couldn't be a paladin anymore, <FirstName>. I just couldn't see the justice..."

"No, I knew it even then. I didn't love him but it felt so good just to be loved... After they hung him, I fled to that tree and cried like my heart was broken. I couldn't be a paladin anymore, couldn't see the justice..."

"And I died young, too, and so did he. After they hung him I fled into the woods and found that tree and curled between its roots... I couldn't be a paladin anymore. I just couldn't see the justice in it..."

"What I couldn't bring myself to understand was that it wasn't justice for him, it was justice for me... If only I wouldn't have been so blind, perhaps there wouldn't have been so much horror in the world..."
"Go. Talk to this Knower of Places and learn from her what you can. After that, let us be done with this place. It holds too many memories of my wrongs."
"It's not from here. I don't think any of these places are. I don't even think we're in Cania anymore, <FirstName>..."
"But how could she know about that tree?"
"But that tree..."
"No, it had my initials in it... and a heart... I'm telling you, I know that tree!"
"That one that flew by, just as we entered!"
"Well I was thinking of something a little more pleasurable..."

"Yes, it's a mimic, isn't it? But did you see how it grappled away like that? I don't think I've ever heard of anything quite like it before... Come, let's get your clothes back. Your teeth are beginning to rattle."
"Are you flirting with me?"
"It is, is it?"
"Whew! I'm so sorry, <FirstName>. It's just... It feels good to laugh again. I'm afraid it's been awhile... Now let's get those clothes back for you; I can hear your teeth rattling."
"Take no insult. If I laugh, it is because you have more than exceeded my expectations, <FirstName>."
"I might be... This may come as a bit of a surprise but we paladins have been known to fall in love and marry on occasion..."
"I'm a paladin, not a prude. This may come as a bit of a surprise but we've been known to fall in love and even marry on occasion..."
"No? Then let us remember that for the future, <FirstName>... But right now we need to get your clothes back. I can hear your teeth rattling."
"Yes, love... Is the word so frightening?"
"I'm sorry, I didn't mean for you to feel uncomfortable... Let's go get your clothes back. I can hear your teeth rattling."
"There is more to love than flesh alone, <FirstName>... Forget I even mentioned it..."
"I do too... But let's get your clothes back, <FirstName>. I can hear your teeth rattling."
"Oh don't be such a child! I wasn't speaking of you anyway... I was speaking of Fenthick... Forget I even mentioned it..."
"To the dead, perhaps all things taste of life. I don't know, <FirstName>, maybe dust and time are my life now. The spirit grows old, I think, even after the body's gone..."
"I don't understand you! You're all full of support and encouragement one minute, then spite and vitriol in the next... Well I made my decision and, unlike you, I intend to stick with it."
"So go do what you must with the Sleeping Man. The sooner it's done, the sooner you can go home."

"And I didn't mean to be so maudlin. It seems like everything is moving so fast, that's all. Becoming a paladin again takes a little getting used to. I thought some of these emotions were gone forever..."
"But we came here to see the Sleeping Man. Come, let's do what we set out to do here..."
"And a sadness, too. Happiness because his love is coming to him, sadness because she is not yet here. That's how hope works, I think... The two mingle."
"Fair enough. The sooner you learn the Gatekeeper's True Name, the sooner you can return home."
"It's good to be happy. I wasn't sure if I ever would be again. And to think that there was a time I took it for granted, <FirstName>... At any rate, let's do what we came here to do, yes?"
"Some ghosts haunt and some are haunted. I guess I'm one of the latter. But yes, thanks to you, <FirstName>, I guess I'm hopeful... Now let's do what we came here to do."
"How can you not feel it? Do you not even have an ounce of joy in you? An ounce of hope?"
"We all do, <FirstName>. Even me, and I've got a lot more reasons never to go back than most. Maybe that's why we have to do it... Come, let's do what we came here to do and see where it leads us."
"You're an impossible old grump, <FirstName>, but I suppose I owe you that much. I suppose I didn't have much hope a while ago either, did I... Come, let's do what we came here to do."
"No, <FirstName>, don't you see? Hope sustains us! How long has the Sleeping Man been here, an angel in the very depths of Baator, yet he lies here unmolested, even venerated."
"He's here just as much as you are. And I am, too. Joy is about being able to find good even in bad situations. Hope is about trusting that bad situations will someday get better."
"If you insist, <FirstName>... Do what you will."
"Well... a lot, actually. But we can start with a little, I suppose... Now let's go do what we came here for."
"I'm not lecturing... It's just hard to see you so unhappy, that's all. I'm just trying to help... Oh never mind, let's do what we came here for, then."
"It is not vengeance that I seek, <FirstName>... All I ask for is a little hope. That a world that has seen a great evil can also see great good... And that a heart can say the same..."
"I suppose we have no time for delay... A great evil lurks in our home world, Toril. We must shine Tyr's light upon it and sap away its power. Come, let us make our peace with the world."
"No... Please, <FirstName>, do not do this..."

"But what I did was wrong! Countless innocents died by my actions and countless friends as well. To feel no guilt, no remorse, is to become cold to the world. It would be inhuman. Is that what you ask of me?"
"Thank you, <FirstName>. The ability to take responsibility for my past is the only dignity that still remains to me... Is there anything you would ask in its stead?"
"I suppose the gods have their mysteries. But what is commanded in their tongue must have their sanction, for good or ill. By your command, I am atoned... Is there anything more?"
"Then I will not suffer, you have my word. It shall be as you command. Is there anything more you would ask of me?"
"A curse, then, upon your descendants. May they each come to know despair... It will be as you command. Have you any other sufferings to heap upon me?"
"My soul? But that is all I have! I know not what power it might grant you but, without it, I will join the Lost... Are you sure this is what you want?"
"For that, I thank you. Please, <FirstName>, stop this madness! For my sake, I beg you, ask nothing more..."
"As you command, <FirstName>..."
"But I am a paladin again, something I could not have achieved without you! ...Yet this is your command and I must obey... Damn you, <FirstName>, let there be nothing more you would ask of me!"
"But how can it be love? ...Alas, you have commanded me and I will love you in whatever fashion I am able until the end of my days... Is there anything else you demand of me?"

"It's just... All I ever wanted was to be loved. Is it too late? I mean, what if I go through that portal and there's nothing there for me on the other side? I can't bear to simply relive things, lose myself in the past..."
"But do you love me, <FirstName>?"

"More than anything in all the world. My only regret is that I had to die to find you. If you cannot love me in return, I understand. It was in the Hells that I met you, after all... But please, do you love me? Can you love me?"
"No? ...I suppose I should have known. Some things are too much to hope for in one life or the next."
"Yes, well... loving you was against my better judgment, too..."
"And I with mine."
"As you are mine."
You can feel Aribeth's malevolent eyes boring into you. You can tell she has something to say but she seems intent on making you be the one to ask her.
"Madness is the wisdom of the enlightened."
"Perhaps it is different in some worlds than it is in ours but here, the Hells are but another stop along the lengthy pilgrimage of the soul, a black bead along a string of pearls."

"Death is a beginning, not an end. Life is but a fraction of our existence, a simple tutorial preparing us for the many lives beyond. The Heavens and the Hells lie along a continuum but even they can't encompass all that is."
"It hardly seems enough, truth be told. The nature of punishment is that those who most deserve it are also those who take the most perverse pleasure in its administration."
"For the truly black at heart, the Nine Hells hold all the pleasures that a paladin might find in Seven Mounting Heavens of Celestia. Perhaps even a little more, if I dare say so myself..."
"Given the choice, I would make it a little warmer... And a lot more black, I think."
"What more is there to say of the Hells, really..."

"I look good in black, that's all... What makes the Hells so horrible are their arbitrary nature, you see? If it were black for a reason, then that blackness would lose its power over the minds of its inhabitants."

"I am beginning to think that it would not even be necessary. Mephistopheles has abandoned Cania. He hopes to make Toril his throne now. With a little ambition, all things are possible in the Nine Hells."
"He doesn't need it anymore. He who rules the deepest Hell of Baator rules them all! Asmodeus rules the Ninth but our friend is hoping to turn Toril into the Tenth and thereby seize the prize."

"According to my temple training, the outer planes are divinely morphic: He (or She) who rules the plane can also shape it. Why all this ice and lava side by side? It is because Mephistopheles made it so."
"Yes, I toil over them within my heart, fashioning them into the shape that will be my vengeance..."

"That is why I refuse to forget it, <FirstName>. Fools must not be suffered. They must be purged and their foolish blood must form a paint so we can write our curses on their walls... So shall it be in Neverwinter."
"I keep thinking of Lord Nasher as he stood before the mob to announce that both Fenthick and Desther were to be put to death. I know now what it is I saw in him... Fear. Cold, hard fear."

"Perhaps... But I keep thinking of Lord Nasher as he stood before the mob to announce that both Fenthick and Desther were to be put to death. I know now what it is I saw in him... Fear. Cold, hard fear."
"Don't you see? The mob in the streets, in their plague-struck squalor, held more power than a lord sitting in comfort on his throne! He ruled them but even so, he feared them."
"In the end, I could only hate Lord Nasher for so much. He was but a single man, a single vessel for my wrath and my wrath overflowed. It was upon the mob that I truly swore my vengeance..."
"Lord Nasher insisted that, as paladin of Tyr, I be the one to declare their guilt but I refused. The old man didn't want to face the crowds waiting outside the temple doors."
"But I made him do it and in that moment I could tell that he was a small little man and that he hated me. And when Fenthick's neck snapped within that wretched noose... I knew I was transformed."

"They were both fools. I told myself I loved the former and I suffered the latter in silence. I should have taken the chance to kill them both when I had it. Instead I left them to Lord Nasher and the mob."

"Desther posed as a Tyrran priest come from afar to serve the church but instead he spread disease with every blessing. Fenthick refused to see it and how could I doubt the man I told myself I loved..."
--------- Random Conversations begin here ----------
"The enemy of my enemy is my friend. Come, let us ignore the pale-faced Knower for a spell and see if we can free the generals in her stead..."
"That much is true. We face a cunning and ruthless adversary. We must be cunning and ruthless in return... But you're right. Blinded by their fury, these generals would be nothing more than fodder."
"It is names that hold power and the Knower of Names we must find. Let us pry from her every name she knows. With that as our arsenal, we will be invincible!"
"Well there's only one way to find out, isn't there... Are you not tempted by their power?"
"What are you implying, <FirstName>? I was a traitor too, if you haven't forgotten..."
"I already have... But as I was saying, we have some generals to consider..."

"Well you should have, you fool! I would betray you in a heartbeat if I thought it to be in my interest! Every moment of my loyalty, you grow deeper in my debt. Someday I will call it in... Now, about these generals..."
"Good. Because I never said you were wrong... Now, about these generals..."
"It's in the Neverwinter Wood, northeast of the city. Fenthick first kissed me there and we carved our initials in the tree... I was such a stupid girl. I should have burned that forest down!"
"After they hung him I fled into the woods and found our tree and curled between its roots. I could have burnt it then but instead I cried like a weak-willed girl and swore my vengeance."
"No, I knew it even then. I didn't love him but it felt so good just to be loved... After they hung him, I fled to our tree in the woods and cried like my heart was broken and swore my vengeance."
"And I died young, too, and so did he. After they hung him I fled into the woods and found our tree and curled between its roots. I cried like a baby and swore my vengeance."

"I will have that vengeance still, <FirstName>... Go. Talk to this Knower of Places, wring from her the information that we need, and let us be done with this place. It holds too many memories of past weakness."
"It's not from here. I don't think any of these places are. I don't even think we're in Cania anymore, <FirstName>... Can you imagine having this kind of power?"
"But how could she know about that tree?"
"But that tree..."
"No, it had my initials in it... and a heart... I'm telling you, I know that tree!"
"That one that flew by, just as we entered!"
"Play the fool if you wish, it's none of my business..."
"No, it seems more appropriate that you suffer the indignity of my presence..."
"You think so, do you honey? That's nice but I prefer to prey on men... Now go retrieve your clothes. Your corpulent flesh disgusts me."
"How much is it worth to you, my dear? 70,000 gold?"
"Mum's the word, honey bunch."
"I threw that away long ago, princess... Now go put some other clothes on. Your corpulent flesh disgusts me."
"Don't get me started, darling..."
"If I would have known you'd be so easy to disrobe..."
"A touchy subject, is it? I'll have to remember that... Go retrieve your clothes, then. Your corpulent flesh disgusts me."
"Not so fast, <FirstName>. I set the rules and you follow them. If you're a good boy, I might even tell you that I love you. For now, let's just say I've taken a carnal interest..."

"I may be dead, <FirstName>, but the pleasures of the flesh are still as alluring and there are things I never had the chance to do in life... I will not promise you my love or loyalty but my lust is yours."
"But first let's fry that little beast and make it suffer... It seems a fitting celebration."
She responds with stony silence, her eye boring jagged holes into your heart.
"I feel like he's judging me, all right? He's a celestial, an angel. Perhaps he's even in Tyr's service... I have made my decisions and I will not be judged! Not by him, not by anyone."
"Fine, then let's be done with it. You had better know what you're doing..."
"He's fast asleep just like I'm long dead... There may be some truth to it but it doesn't tell the whole story."
"I don't know. He wants something from us, though, just like we want something from him. I can feel it. I can see it in how he sleeps... I just don't like owing favors to angels..."
"Vengeance... Then let us have ours, <FirstName>... Toril is ours by right. We show no mercy. We take no prisoners. We return home and we return to conquer... No turning back."
"Yes, vengeance... Tell me true, though, <FirstName>. Do you really love me?"

"I don't want your pity! ...Toril is ours by right! We show no mercy. We take no prisoners. We return home and we return to conquer! We raze it to the ground, <FirstName>, and build anew... It's the only way."
"Then let us tear these devils from our backs and slay them, <FirstName>... Toril is ours by right. We show no mercy. We take no prisoners. We return home and we return to conquer..."
"No... What are you doing? How dare you!"
"Good, I am glad you have come to your senses. Now let us hurry, Mephistopheles awaits."
"Don't be silly, <FirstName>. You don't need to command me by my True Name for that! To the contrary, I revel in it. The books of history will remember me as a great evil... Anything more?"
"My soul? But that is all I have! I know not what power it might grant you but, without it, I will join the Lost... Are you sure this is what you want?"
"For that, I thank you. Is there anything else you would force upon me?"
"As you command, <FirstName>..."
"But I am a blackguard, a path I chose on your advice! ...But you leave me no choice. I will do as you command... Please let there be nothing more you would ask of me."
"My... My lord? ...You have commanded me and I will love you in whatever fashion I am able until the end of my days... Is there anything else you demand of me?"
"But do you love me, <FirstName>? Do you really?"
"It will make what I am about to do a little easier..."
"Betray you..."
"It was just a game we played... I understand..."
"Good... I didn't want there to be any misconceptions..."
"Yes, well... loving you was against my better judgment, too..."
"And the blackness of my own..."
"As you are mine..."
Aribeth smiles sadly amidst the gathering gloom. You find yourself wondering if it pains the dead to die again.
Aribeth leers at you from the gathering gloom. She seems to have taken pleasure in the terror of another death.
------- This line must be placed at the end of inter-party banter ---------
"Must you always seek out the light? I am an assassin, Aribeth, a Red Sister. It is what I was born to do."
"It's just that I turn around and you're not there..."
"Oh I'm there, my Lady. I promise you that."
"But if I can't see you, how do I know you're not..."
"Not what? Not about to slice your throat? Slice <FirstName>'s? Look, I've known <him/her> longer than you. <FirstName> *chose* me. You're the one who shouldn't be trusted!"
"What do you mean? <He/She> saved me from becoming one of the Lost! I have something to live for again! Why can't you trust me?"
"I should ask the same of you but if you want my answer, here it is: You make it look a little too easy! A few empty words and suddenly you're born again!"

"I've lived all my life on the knife edge, trying to figure out right from wrong, good from evil, and I'm still on that knife edge! There is no resolution, no happily ever after! So why should there be for you?"
"This is my happily ever after? Cursed to wander a frozen Hell in penance for my crimes, hounded by an arrogant drow who believes she's the only one who's ever suffered?"

"When the dawn comes, sure it comes all at once but that doesn't make the night before it any shorter! I've had my night already. I lived through it, I died through it... Maybe you'll have to do the same."
"Please, just leave me alone, all right?"
"I keep my own counsel, spirit, and recommend you do the same."
"But I'm curious, my sister... Who was this Valsharess you served?"
"She was the leader of the house I was sworn to protect."
"And powerful, too, I hear..."
"She was greatly feared, yes... But in the end she was weak. Her power was not her own. She relied on a male's power, on Mephistopheles, and that is why she fell."
"Yes, it is a good thing that we are all women here. Men bring nothing but despair and the treachery of the heart."
"You speak as if from experience..."
"In life, I served many men and all of them betrayed me. Lord Nasher, Tyr himself, Fenthick... It is only in serving women that I've been strong. Morag, <FirstName>, myself..."
"Yourself?"
"You are still young, little sister. There will come a time when it will become clear to you that there is no one left worth serving."
"Yes, Aribeth... I understand."
"Like you rely on <FirstName>?"
"I rely on nothing but the sharpness of my blades and my training as a Red Sister! Leave <FirstName> out of this!"
"But how, little sister? It is because of him that we are here, it is his quest we follow. In the end, who will be saved? Your precious Seer? My Neverwinter? Don't be a fool!"
"I didn't exactly ask to come to the Hells! They were thrust upon me, just as you were! That <FirstName> is trapped here as well has nothing to do with it!"
"Have you grown so used to not being seen that now you cannot see yourself? <FirstName> has everything to do with it! This is his story, can't you tell?"
"Then when I get the chance, I will make it my own!"
"As will I, little sister. As will I..."
"I keep hearing voices, m'Lady. It is as if the very essence of this plane hunts me. And then the anger, it just builds and builds in me. Gah! I don't know how much longer I can contain it all."

"Listen to my voice, then. Focus on my voice and tune all the others out. The outer planes live and breathe of their own accord. Devils are literally borne of Cania's essence, like fruit from a larger tree."
"I cannot do it, m'Lady! I will never make it home. I am a demon in Baator, it will never let me leave!"

"You must. I will help you. I was one of the Lost, remember? I was one with this plane but for a moment, like sap in the tree. It cannot hurt you, it cannot claim you. It can only take you if you give yourself to it."

"Listen to my voice... Cania, it is I, the Lady Aribeth, the one who was Lost within you but then was Found. This man, Valen, is not your enemy. He will pass through you like the wind and then be gone..."

"Let him go. His blood is of the Tanar'ri, of your enemies in the Abyss, but his heart is of the world of Toril which is not yours to claim. Listen to my voice, the voice of one who was Lost, and let him go..."
"It... It's receding. The voices... Thank you, m'Lady. I dare not think what would have become of me had you not been here."
"Don't thank me yet, Valen. Just pray it doesn't come back before we return home. If it does, it will want us both and it will be very, very mad... Come on, let's keep moving."
"Why do you still haunt me, ghost? I am the one who grows stronger. If the demon in me grows, it is because it is but half of me."

"Or are you but half of it? Only half of your father's greatness, only half your father's power... Look at you grow, Valen. How long until your true nature eats a hole through this thin coat of righteousness?"
"You're just a spirit! You know nothing of my fate, of what will or will not be!"

"Do you really believe that, Valen? I am of the dead. I am one whose fate is long since spent. In a way, I am your destiny. I am what you will become. Mark my words: The demon in you grows and will soon consume you."
"Lies! I would rather kill myself than be consumed!"
"Then it seems you have a decision to make, don't you, Valen..."
"I will take you with me if I go, devil!"
"Really? How romantic... Very well, you know where I sleep."
"A little, Lady Aribeth. I anger more quickly here and it always feels as if something watches me... What of you?"
"Thanks to <FirstName>, I must admit that the Hells have not been the torment I had expected. I deserved far worse, that I know. In many ways, my soul is less troubled now than it had been in life."
"Perhaps Cania does not affect me as much as it might some other tieflings. My father was a demon, after all, rather than a devil. He would only have come to Baator in times of battle."
"The Blood War."
"Yes, the war between evils. I admit that my yearning to paint my blade with Mephistopheles' black blood stems from more than just vengeance or the cause of good. The demon in me wants it as well."
"That is fair, as long as the human in you wants it as well. You may not think it but your mother's heritage is strong in you and far more vital in the end."
"Thank you, Aribeth. Those are heartening words to hear in this cold place."
"What do you mean, dead one..."
"You are in the Hells, now, tiefling. Does your fiendish blood boil here, bubble up to reach the surface? If ever there was a time to tap your father's heritage..."

"I chart my own course, witch. Neither my father's nor my mother's but one between. Besides, my father was a demon, not a devil. If his blood were to boil here, it would be of rage and the smell of battle."

"Evil is evil, fool! It is the Blood War that holds us back! The forces of good are weak but at least they stand united. Meanwhile we children of evil prey upon each other, wasting all our strength and cunning!"
"Look, woman, I'm no general and from what I hear, you weren't all that great a one yourself! I've heard the story of Neverwinter... If you're so cunning, how come you're dead?"
"Enough!"
"You were captured and executed! You're nothing but a story now! A footnote! Nobody cares!"
"Enough..."
"Nobody cares... So either you work with me or you don't. I didn't pick this fight, all right? I'm just here to do a job and get home again..."
"Deekin is cold all right but not too cold. He wears socks!"
"You wear socks? How delightful!"

"Wool socks. Deekin's grandma made them for him long ago. And mittens. 'Don't forget to sun on the rocks!' she'd always say. Or 'You'll catch your death of cold, you will!' Then she'd feed Deekin insects. The yummy ones."
"It's strange to think back to Neverwinter and my days in the temple there. Everything seemed so black and white. I never would have known that a kobold could be so charming..."
"Of course, it's very hard to strum a lute with one's mittens on... Gloves would have been a lot more practical, Deekin thinks... Do you know how to knit, Miss Aribeth?"
"Ha! No, Deekin, I haven't a clue how to knit! I'm afraid it was one of those things that just didn't seem important at the time... When we get home, maybe your grandma can teach me."
"For you, anything, Miss Aribeth! She does talk your ear off, though. Something about snow being over her head and paths running uphill both ways. It never made any sense to Deekin."
"Deekin wears socks!"
"I beg your pardon?"

"Wool socks. Deekin's grandma made them for him long ago. And mittens. 'Don't forget to sun on the rocks!' she'd always say. Or 'You'll catch your death of cold, you will!' Then she'd feed Deekin insects. The yummy ones."
"Forget I asked..."
"Of course, it's very hard to strum a lute with one's mittens on... Gloves would have been a lot more practical, Deekin thinks... Do you know how to knit? ...Miss Aribeth? ...Hello?"
"Deekin writes a new song for if... for when he goes back to his kobold home."
"Don't worry, we'll get you home, little one. You have my word... In the meantime, maybe you could sing that song for me..."

"Deekin not finished yet but it go like this: 'The mighty wise kobold, Deekin the Green got sent to the Hells by aaaaccident. He did nothing wrong! Honest, it's true! He got sent to the Hells by aaaaccident...'"
"There now, I'm sure they'll understand. And it sounds like it will be a very nice song..."
"It rhymes better in kobold, of course..."
"I'm sure it does, little one. I'm sure it does."
"Deekin not be underfoot! Your foot always be over Deekin! Bad foot! Bad!"
"Bad? Your little brain can't comprehend even half of what it means to be bad, lizard. Do you want me to show you what bad really is?"
"Umm... not really, evil lady."
"Not really? You're like an insolent child... Call me by my name!"
"N-not really, M-miss Aribeth..."
"Good. Then stay out from underfoot as I commanded in the first place... And leave me alone..."

"He was devouring us, eating our very souls to build his army... I'll serve no army! Never again! I served Tyr, I served Lord Nasher, I served Morag and her Old Ones! All my life I've worn their colors, waved their flags..."
"I'll not serve Mephistopheles now, after I've gambled and lost so much! ...So yes, I challenged him. The other spirits thought I did it for them but they are fools. I serve only myself, now."

"Mephistopheles found humor in my challenge and heard me out, listening patiently until I ran out of words to speak. There, in the silence, he gave voice to the one secret I have harbored within me for so long..."
"Fenthick Moss, cleric of Tyr, hung as a traitor, the man I was about to marry, the man I've always said I loved... I never loved him... I never loved him and somehow Mephistopheles knew the truth."

"Don't you see? When they hung him, I abandoned my church, my faith, my god. I led an army of evil against Neverwinter, my own city. I wrought destruction on the world and damned my soul to the Hells..."

"And to have not done that out of love, out of grief, out of righteous anger? My entire life has been a lie. A paladin of vanity, a blackguard of denial, they were equal poisons coursing through my veins."
"Isn't there? Evil is a choice you make. That is the source of its power. Failing to do good is simply complacency, sloth. True evil is the wilful pursuit of corruption and villainy."
"Evil for evil's sake... You present an argument I can't refute, firestarter. Very well, my hatred of the world has been fueled by your fire and hardened by this ice..."

"The Hells... Cania... You present an argument I can't refute, firestarter. One can only fight one's destiny for so long. Very well, my hatred of the world has been fueled by your fire and hardened by this ice..."

"On this blade, on my names, both true and given, and on all the devils in the depths of Baator, I commit all the days that remain to me to the pursuit of evil for evil's sake. May they learn to fear me!"
"Nonsense. I was wretched at it. Plagued by guilt, blinded by anger, filled with doubt... In life, I played at being evil, nothing more."

"I have had my vengeance and while it lasted, it was sweet indeed. As for power, I have no taste for it. If I am to be evil, I will be evil for evil's sake itself. There is no evil more cold than that."
"Yes, I do. I doubt everything, even myself. Gods can make mistakes, as can devils, as can ghosts, as can mortals. How could Tyr still want me after all I've done?"
"I did, I truly did. It's true I did not love Fenthick but there was no justice in his hanging, just appeasement of a mob and the weakness of an aging ruler."
"Justice, then... You present an argument I can't refute, firestarter. Perhaps my faith has been refined by your fire and strengthened by this ice. Very well, I shall do as you say..."
"Let Tyr decide... You present an argument I can't refute, firestarter. Perhaps my faith has been refined by your fire and strengthened by this ice. Very well, I shall do as you say..."
"No, but I acted all the same. Righteous is the one who does what's right when surrounded on all sides by evil. I did not."
"Righteous... You present an argument I can't refute, firestarter. Perhaps my faith has been refined by your fire and strengthened by this ice. Very well, I shall do as you say..."

"On this blade, on my names, both true and given, and on all the good and evil I have done in life, I commit all the days that remain to me, for better or for worse, to Tyr and to his justice. Let it be so!"
"I don't see Tyr down here in the Hells... I don't need some god to take responsibility for what I've done. I made my actions knowingly and knowingly I pay the price."
"As a paladin, I was loved, I was venerated, I was lifted up unto that narrow pedestal. In their eyes, I could do no wrong nor speak no ill. What would you have done in my place?"
"If you tell someone they are perfect, they will show you they are flawed... I sowed the seeds of my own destruction because I needed humbling. So did all those who made such high demands of me."

"Then he has succeeded, for here I am in the middle of things, neither good nor evil, neither paladin nor blackguard, wanting nothing but to become nothing and meld my soul into the essence of Cania."
"He was a well-intentioned fool but a fool nonetheless. But he was young and a priest of the Church I served. To marry him was to marry the Church. It all seemed too perfect to be wrong..."
"Then why do I know his words are true? I never loved Fenthick... I wish I had."
Lady Aribeth runs her ghostly fingers through her hair. You can feel her tension channeling through you, passing through your bones and dissipating.
"What of it? I have seen evil done in a good man's name and nobility in a cause the good despised. Does that make me good? Does that make me evil? No, only cynical and jaded and weary of the world."
"That's funny. I don't think I know myself anymore. I know my name, I know the facts and details, I know the story of my fall... I was once a paladin of Tyr, there was a plague, I loved a man..."

"All of it seems like some horrible fairy tale, like a story about someone else from long ago. Maybe that's all it was... Maybe that's how you knew it as well. I don't know... I try to forget those times."
"Do you want the truth? What if I told you that I don't like who I was in life. I don't even know if I like who I am now. It seems better to become one of the Lost, numb even to memories."
"I see that..."
"What do you care indeed, firestarter... So leave me be."
"No, I don't think you do. Please, leave me be."
"I do. Please, just leave me be."
"Why did you light that fire?"
"Yes, but I was trying to be forgotten... I attacked you for your memory."
"And I have answers I had no intention to give. I attacked you for your curiosity."
"Maybe so but it was my mistake to make. I attacked you for your self-righteousness."
"You know nothing of torture, of anguish, of pain! I attacked you for your ignorance."
"Well I didn't need yours so I attacked you for your selfishness."
"What makes you think I want your pity? I attacked you for your arrogance."

"I'm a traitor, will you trust me? I'm dead, will you return me to life? I'm hated, will you love me? I've lost my innocence, will you help me find it? ...Save your breath. There are some things you can't get back."
"You have 'saved' me for a foolish question of faith? What makes you think I have the answers? Go beg the gods for your precious answers and may they spite you as they have me."
"There's the rub, isn't it? Everyone wants answers and we'll travel to the ends of everything to find them, only to learn that they were never there to begin with."
"I played the sensei's little game, I learned her Five-Fold Precious Mysteries, and to what end? The dreams of the Sleeping Man are just that: dreams... They can be shattered like any other."

"Help? Must I? I played the sensei's little game, I learned her Five-Fold Precious Mysteries, and to what end? The dreams of the Sleeping Man are just that: dreams... They can be shattered like any other."
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> "If it's so important to you, then you don't deserve to know. Perhaps that will teach not to disturb a Lady's rest..."
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> "You want to know the answer? The Fifth-Fold Mystery? 'She will find you by the Gates of Cania.' That's your foolish answer. Make of it what you will, firestarter."
"They made a corpse of the man I loved, a mockery of the justice I believed in, and a demon of the woman I became. You should have let me join the Lost for I have little else to keep me here."
"And who are you to ask such a thing? Please, it is better that I forget him... It would be better yet to forget it all... Just leave me be."
Ice melts from her face like tears and her hair clings damply to her brow. For the first time, you realize that she's beautiful. Confused, frightened, and defiant, she attacks.
The fire's ashes are cold and pale.
As the berries break open, bursts of energy spark forth, igniting the wood near you. In the heat of the resulting bonfire, the woman before you begins to stir...

As the berries break open, bursts of energy spark forth, igniting the wood near you. It's a goodly blaze but the warmth seems insufficient to penetrate the frozen statue before you. You'll need a bigger fire.
As the berry breaks open, a burst of energy sparks forth, igniting the wood near you. The fire seems too small to warm the icy cavern, however...
Cania's bitter winds extinguish your paltry flame before it even has a chance to catch. You will have to find some other way to make a fire.
Tendrils of magic bar your way. Beyond them you can hear a woman's sobs. Her voice, hollow and cold, echoes off the icy walls of her self-imposed prison.
"No, that's it."
"I think we need to part ways."
"All right, fine. Stay with me, then."
"Wait here until I return."
"Leave me. Now."
"I want to change your tactics."
"I don't want to change anything else right now."
"I don't want you to cast any spells until I say otherwise."
"I want you to go ahead and cast spells on your own."
"Do not try to use dispel magic spells to remove disabling effects from party members."
"Use dispel magic spells to remove disabling effects from party members."
"I want you to leave any traps you see alone for now."
"I want you to disarm any traps that you see."
"Don't try to be stealthy anymore."
"Stay stealthy, but only until the next fight."
"I need you to be stealthy right now."
"Don't help me if I fail to open a locked door or chest."
"Help me if I fail to open a locked door or chest."
"I want to change the distance you stay away from me."
"Stay a long distance away from me."
"Keep a medium distance."
"Stay close."
"Go ahead and attack as soon as you see enemies."
"Defend me and don't attack until I do."
"I want to adjust your equipment."
"Can you identify my equipment?"
"I want you to use one of your special abilities."

"Lay on Hands."
"I need you to cast a group of buffing spells."

"What was it you wanted to say earlier?"

"How are you feeling?"
"What are you going to do when all this is over?"
"Back to my other questions."
"A sound plan. I'm impressed, Aribeth."
"No, I won't allow it."
"Assuming you can leave Cania..."
"To what end?"
"Why did you almost become one of the Lost?"
"Back to my other questions."
"The Hells can pose no threat to any of us."
"You're welcome, Aribeth. I'm happy to have helped."
"Hmph. I should have known to leave things be..."
"What is it like to be a spirit?"
"Back to my other questions."
"Much as I expected, then."
"It must be horrible for you!"
"It could be worse..."
"What exactly happened in Neverwinter, anyway?"
"Goodbye."
"Back to my other questions."
"How did you die? How did you end up here?"
"But they defeated you. They turned you back..."
"Why would you do such a thing?"
"Whose army did you lead?"
"But who did you serve?"

"Why would you wish to be ignorant?"

"You didn't love Fenthick?"
"Whose army did you lead?"
"But before that. You lived there, didn't you?"
"What hypocrisy?"
"Not right now, Aribeth. Stay warm."
"Yes, I'd like you to travel with me again."
"Not really. I just wanted to rub your nose in it a little."
"Come along but keep your comments to yourself."
"Sorry, not now. We'll talk about it later."
"Yes, Aribeth?"
"Goodbye."
"Well I have no time to hear your religious lectures."
"You're the expert. Explain to me the nature of the Hells..."
"Do you take issue with your punishment?"
"The Hells are a little colder than I expected, that's for sure."
"Back to my other questions."
"Why ice and lava? It doesn't make sense."
"Mephistopheles is coming back, isn't he?"
"Why would he just abandon this place?"
"Temple training?"
"Goodbye."
"Keep them to yourself. I have no time to hear them."
"Forget Neverwinter! It was nothing but a city of fools."
"What memories?"
"Not happy memories, I assume?"
"Why would Lord Nasher have been scared?"
"Tell me of their deaths."
"Tell me of Fenthick and Desther."
"Goodbye."
"That's a responsibility I'll shoulder, then."
"Don't worry. All we want is the Gatekeeper's."
"If that's what it takes to do good in the world."
"Hold on, we need to free her first."
"Stop lecturing me, all right? I can handle it!"
"What's the matter? Scared I might learn yours?"
"I'll keep it in mind."
"You give sound advice, Aribeth. I will heed it well."
"Goodbye."
"Where do you recognize it from?"
"Innocent?"
"You thought you loved him."
"You were young."
"But you've never been here before."
"Where do you recognize the tree from?"
"I think we've found the Knower of Places, then."
"Don't get your hopes up."
"It's just any old tree."
"What tree?"
"Goodbye."
"Yes, I'm plotting a painful demise for the little beast..."
"And I couldn't help see the look of interest on yours..."
"You'd be shocked too. It's rather cold down here."
"Keep you hands to yourself, ghost. I'm not interested."
"Hey now, I thought you were supposed to be good!"
"Mind your own business... And stop laughing."
"Well keep your hands to yourself. I'm not interested."
"Are you flirting with me?"
"Expectations? I thought you were supposed to be good!"
"Well I'm not interested, all right?"
"A surprise but not an unwelcome one."
"Love?"
"I... I just don't think I'm ready for it, Aribeth."
"When it comes to dead girls? Yes. Definitely frightening."
"Frightening? Terrifying is more like it!"
"No, I think I like it..."
"Whoa, slow down. Marry?"
"Goodbye."
"All I feel is the weight of dust and time."
"It serves you right, you traitor..."
"Good, I'm glad I'm not the only one."
"I'm sorry, I didn't mean to be so harsh."
"Yes, I can. There's a happiness here."
"All right, let's get down to business."
"It's good to see you happy."
"That's how you are, too, isn't it?"
"It's all in your head. Now stop your prancing around."
"I just want to go home, Aribeth."
"Fine, I can feel it! But you can't make me like it..."
"Hope just gets you killed."
"Being trapped in the Nine Hells put a damper on things..."
"Let's just drop it, all right? We've got work to do."
"You're right, I need to loosen up a little."
"I'm not interested in a lecture on virtues, Aribeth."
"Goodbye."
"Through that portal is vengeance, nothing more."
"True, I must face Mephistopheles with no evil in my heart."
"Hope, then. It doesn't matter. Just follow."
"To each their own. For me, it is vengeance."
"It's all right. I'm going with you."
"We all have devils on our back, Aribeth."
"Let's go."
<StartAction>[Aribeth]</Start> "Va'ardalia the Twinsouled..."
"Nothing. Never mind..."
"Feel no guilt regarding what transpired in Neverwinter."
"You are right. I will not ask that of you."
"Don't you see? This is your atonement... It's all right..."
"I just don't want to see you suffer so."
"Yes, Aribeth. Dead and cold..."
"Surrender your soul to me!"
"If it means losing you, then no."
"Yes, I am sure."
[VFX. ARIBETH TURNS TO ICE. PLAYER GETS SOME ENHANCEMENT. EVIL ALIGNMENT HIT]
"I command you to pursue evil, not good."
"I command you to love me..."
"That is all, Aribeth."
"That portal is the future, not the past."
"I'll be there. There, on the other side."
"But you are loved."
"It's never too late, Aribeth."
"Do you want me to?"
"No, Aribeth. I never did."
"Well, we've had our fun but I wouldn't call it love..."
"Against my better judgment, I'm afraid I do."
"Yes, I do. With all my heart."
"You are my one true love."
"Save it for later, ghost."
"Spit it out, Aribeth..."
"Goodbye."
"Well I have no time to hear your maddened prattling."

"Do you take issue with your punishment?"

"Warmer I can understand but blacker?"

"Given the choice?"

"Then keep them to yourself."
"Forget Neverwinter! It was nothing but a city of fools."
"What memories?"
"I would think that would make you happy."
"Why would Lord Nasher have been scared?"
"Tell me of their deaths."
"Tell me of Fenthick and Desther."
"Goodbye."
"I like the way you think, Aribeth..."
"Why bother? Mephistopheles already beat them once."
"I don't think they're interested..."
"Too risky. Traitors can't be trusted..."
"Read into it what you wish, dead one."
"I'm sorry. I didn't mean it that way, Aribeth."
"That's precisely what I'm implying. I have my eye on you..."
"Goodbye."
"Where do you recognize it from?"
"Burned it down?"
"You thought you loved him."
"You were young."
"But you've never been here before."
"Where do you recognize the tree from?"
"I think we've found the Knower of Places, then."
"Don't get your hopes up. We have work to do."
"It's just any old tree."
"What tree?"
"Goodbye."
"Actually, I think I'll stay like this. It's quite freeing, really."
"Well go savor it somewhere else."
"That's not all you're savoring...'
"If you tell a soul, I'll gouge your eyes out..."
"Fine. Take the money and keep your mouth shut."
"Your life?"
"You hideous little blackmailer!"
"Hands off, harlot. I'm not interested in your baited lures."
"Tit for tat, my dear. Now it's your turn."
"If I would have known you'd be so interested..."
"Goodbye."
"Deal with it, princess..."
"What's making you so uncomfortable?"
"I don't like it here, either, but we need his help."
"Nonsense. He's fast asleep."
"Then what's the whole story?"
"Let's go."
"Through that portal is vengeance, nothing more."
"It's all right. I'm going with you."
"We all have devils on our back, Aribeth."

"You are my one true love."
"Come, gentle spirit. Let us finish what we started."
"Rest here awhile. I will travel without you."
"Come, fell spirit. Let us finish what we started."
"Do what you will. I have no further use for you."
"Goodbye."
"I understand you challenged Mephistopheles."
"How did Mephistopheles respond?"
"Why is whether or not you loved him so important?"
"Once you've embraced evil, there's no turning back."
"Fine. Tyr chose you as his paladin, then. Do you doubt his wisdom?"
"Then pursue it now with all the blackness of your heart!"
"You're in the Nine Hells. It's a bit late to doubt your true nature."
"You were very good at being evil, Aribeth."
"Don't you wish to be powerful? To have your vengeance?"
"Tyr chose you as his paladin. Do you doubt his wisdom?"
"Fine. Once you've embraced evil, there's no turning back."
"You acted out of a sense of justice."
"Let Tyr decide if he will take you."
"You did not act alone."
"Then be righteous, here in the depths of Baator."
"Then it is Tyr's mistake, not yours."
"If not for love, why did you do it?"
"Mephistopheles wants you to feel that way."
"You were to marry. How could you not love him?"
"Mephistopheles is just toying with your emotions."
"I live by my own laws as well."
"But what of morality, of good and evil?"
"I think I know you from somewhere."
"Why do you try to forget them?"
"I won't let that happen."
"Fine, what do I care?"
"I understand."
"You don't want that."
"Why did you attack me?"
"I thought I knew you from somewhere."
"I had questions I wanted to ask you."
"I believed you were making a mistake."
"I wanted to torture you."
"I needed your help."
"I felt sorry for you."
"You were cold so I warmed you."
"I seek the Five-Fold Mysteries of the Sleeping Man."
"Back to my other questions."
"Do you know the answer or don't you?"
"Please, m'Lady, you must help."
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> "Then tell me the answer."
"How have the gods spited you?"
"Who was this man you loved?"

A sad-faced, shimmering form coalesces before you. It is a spirit of the dead, banished here to Cania. If it weren't for the frost that clings to its transparent shape, you doubt you'd be able to see it at all.

"It's so cold out here, always this biting, clawing cold... Stay inside if you can or stop by a fire to warm yourself... See the ones with green sparks? Even they are barely enough... It's only a matter of time, you see..."

"Would that I did... Would that I did... Those who know the Reaper's True Name can command him to let you travel anywhere, anywhere at all... To my knowledge, there is only one who holds that answer..."
"Mephistopheles, curse his name..."

"Welcome to the City of Lost Souls, our threadbare encampment in the frozen wastes of Cania... We built it here, around the very Gates themselves... Did we do it recently? ...Maybe... It's so hard to recall..."
The spirit fades out of existence before you, only to reappear, a new layer of frost upon its skin.
"New to the planes, are you? ...Well, the world you once knew is but one of many, all of them jostling for dominance and space within the multiverse..."

"This world or plane is called Cania, one of a handful of planes that, combined, form the realm of Baator... Together with many other such realms, it forms the Outer Planes, where spirits are sent upon their death."

"There are countless other planes and groups of planes as well, each serving some greater purpose, but they are too numerous to describe, let alone count... You'll have to figure it all out on your own..."

"Here in Baator, there are only the Nine, with Asmodeus, King of Devils, living in the deepest... But in the Abyss, where live the demons, the places of torment are said to be infinite in their number and variety..."
"There's very little difference, some would say... Nonetheless, they are bitter enemies and have waged their vicious Blood War across the planes for almost an eternity..."

"But both devils and demons conspire within their own ranks, as well, so perhaps it is simply in the nature of all fiends to fight... Those questions are better left for philosophers than the spirits of the dead..."

"We spirits, of course, though there are less and less of us every day... The devils themselves maintain an outpost here as well, the ice they quarry being in great demand in Cania's distant capital."
"And then there are the githzerai pilgrims who have traveled here to see the Sleeping Man and now are unable to return home..."
The spirit rubs its hands together for warmth, a dusting of frost trickling from between its fingers.

"I know little about the Sleeping Man save that he sleeps in the city's northwest quarter and has been doing so for as long as anyone can remember... Some say he's been there since the dawn of time itself..."
"A couple of decades ago, a githzerai woman built a temple around him and has been leading Pilgrimages from the planes here to worship him... No doubt she would know more..."
"Monks and scholars, for the most part... Now they loiter at the Hellbreath Tavern on the south side of town, sipping mulled ale and counting their coppers..."
"Who knows why devils do anything? You'd best ask Gru'ul, the Quarry Boss."

"Mephistopheles has an army of the dead in the distant world of Toril and he's devouring our souls so he can animate them... He's taken so many of us as it is and still he needs more... Every one of us in a plume of white..."
"Yes, about the city's inhabitants?"

"One tried... She was the boldest among us, the one most full of life... She confronted Mephistopheles and, in his anger, he did something to her... It's only a matter of time before she joins the Lost..."

"The Lost Souls are spirits who no longer yearn for life... They are the ones who have given up... The ice consumes them and they are absorbed into the very essence of despair that forms the plane of Cania."

"Here is where the Scrivener has etched the names of the Lost into the ice that they may be remembered... Here, by the Gates of Cania, where spirits lose hope that they will ever be able to return home."

"We spirits tend not to use names here... Death has brought us to Cania because of the horrible acts we committed in life... It is better to leave all vestiges of that life behind... It is better to forget..."
"Only when we are Lost are our names engraved in the ice for all to know... If we reach that point, it no longer matters..."
"It was done by a creature called the Scrivener but now its former guide has been devoured by Mephistopheles... Without anyone to guide the Scrivener, no one knows what will happen."
"I'm not really sure if it's a who or a what... In some ways, it almost seems more like a pet than a person... Yet its former guide taught it to form simple word pictures, so who's to say..."

"But, for as long as anyone here can remember, the Scrivener's been the one to carve the names of the Lost into the ice... If you look close, the ice is full of them, buried deep... That's how the city got its name..."
"Just another dead soul like the rest of us... But the Dabusi are a gentle race, committed to lives of service... Their native tongue consists of word pictures that they project above their head..."
"Just another dead soul like the rest of us... But now he's just another victim of Mephistopheles' devouring... So many have been taken... So many..."

"She came here full of anger and passion and hope... She was like a fire in this cold place and all of us were drawn to her warmth... When Mephistopheles came to the Gates to announce the Devouring, she challenged him..."
"Whatever he did, it drained her of that fire... Refusing to speak, she sealed herself in the cave at the center of town... Now she dwells within it, slowly growing cold, becoming one of the Lost..."
"Yes, there is... You can put the poor spirit out of her misery... Thanks to Mephistopheles, she's already all but Lost... It's only a matter of time..."
"To help her, you must help the Scrivener... When the Scrivener carves her name into the ice, at that moment will her soul finally join the Lost... It's not peace but it's better than torment..."

The spirit shudders but you cannot tell if it is from fear or a sudden gust of chill wind. "It is a fate worse than death, worse than the Hells... To have one's soul devoured is to become nothing at all."
"Asmodeus banned the other Lords of Hell from going there because evil sown on that plane can lead to great power... Somehow Mephistopheles found a way, though, and now his power knows no bounds..."

"Etched between the countless layers of ice all about the city are the names of the Lost... Not their True Names, for no one knows of those... These are the names they had in life... It's to help us remember..."
The spirit's teeth begin to chatter, their ghostly click somehow the most substantial thing about them.

"The Lost Souls are spirits who no longer yearn for life... They are the ones who have given up... The ice consumes them and they are absorbed into the very essence of despair that forms the plane of Cania."

"It is true that the souls of the dead, once Lost and absorbed into Cania, return as devils... But all vestiges of their past life are lost, including the name they bore in life..."
"Only the True Names remain and that is not the name etched into the city walls... I'm afraid there is nothing there that can help you..."

"Who am I now? ...A ghost, a petitioner, a spirit of the dead, a memory of what has passed... Who was I once? ...A traitor, a murderer, a seller of children? ...I've almost forgotten now... Something that made me choose this..."

"What is good? ...What is evil? ...Perhaps I killed my one true love... Perhaps I sold one child to feed two others... Perhaps I betrayed something I could not believe in... Then again, perhaps I didn't..."

"Either way, it doesn't matter... Whatever else I did in life, what matters is that I chose to come here, to eke out my existence in this place of threadbare tents... And now that I'm here, it's only a matter of time..."
"Either until Mephistopheles devours our souls for his new army or until we succumb to the cold and become one of the Lost... I just want to live, to return home... But that's not possible..."
The spirit sighs wistfully, its ghostly breath hung white with frost.
"As do we all, even if for just a moment... That's why so many gather here, in the City of Lost Souls, waiting, hoping, dreaming, and slowly growing cold... It's only a matter of time..."
"Mephistopheles has sealed the Gates and we spirits can no longer pass through... There was a time when we could return and haunt the places of our death, at least, but no more... Not from here..."

"No, but it is close... When you're there, you can almost smell things again, almost taste things... You see the faces of those you loved, those you hated... To feel emotions again, that's almost living..."

"He didn't want to be followed, perhaps... Besides, I don't think he's coming back... He's stronger in the world of Toril and devouring more of our souls every day... Every one of us in a plume of white..."

"But, for as long as anyone here can remember, the Scrivener's been the one to carve the names of the Lost into the ice... If you look close, the ice is full of them, buried deep... That's how the city got its name..."
